content.graytide.cannibalCook.blurb: The MASSES starve in the streets, but not YOU. While they see only desolation and despair, you have discovered a bounteous FEAST... and a delightful business opportunity. Some people are dying. Other people are hungry. You just might have found a way to solve both their problems.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.predatoryG: People don't like the way you stare, and your eyes linger in the wrong places. Humans roll Reaction at -2, and Morale at +2.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.corpseCart: Racing corpse carts through the streets of Galgenbeck.
At the famous Caf√© de Sang-Froid in Allians.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.foodcart.d: Staffing the first successful food cart in the Valley of Unfortunate Undead.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.prisonStew: Cooking prison stew, deep beneath the Palace of the Shadow King.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.foodFighte: It's a competitive business. You've learned to improvise. Femurs count as 1d6 in your hands. You can make arrowheads from human remains.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.spiceColle: I can't believe it's not... Rotten
Your spice collection can turn even long dead, putrescent corpses into a fitting meal. Fresh corpses improve healing dice one step.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.manEater.d: Count as resting after combat whenever you get the chance to kill someone up close and personal.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.scarredHid: In your desperation, you have even eaten of your own flesh. You have the scar tissue to prove it. Skin counts as light armor, upgrade light armor to medium.
content.graytide.cannibalCook.entrailOra: Open up a fresh human corpse and predict the future. DR 12 presence. Success - regain 1 omen. Failure - lose 1 omen.
